alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Lawrence (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 10:42AM CST until February 07 at 2:34PM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River from Lafayette to Vincennes. .Lowland flooding continues along the Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton, and will arrive at Vincennes Tuesday night. The crest is currently at Covington. Flooding is expected to continue along the lower Wabash at Riverton and Vincennes well into next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 07... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site. * WHEN...Until Wednesday, February 07. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, River cabins become isolated. Basement flooding begins in Hutsonville. Extensive agricultural flooding is in progress. Higher Illinois rural roads in eastern Clark and Crawford counties flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.2 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday, February 07. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 245 AM EST /145 AM CST/.
